update.description:
This pull request replaces qt4 with qt5. Gazebo8 will only support qt5, and no version of gazebo will support both qt4 and qt5.

Changes include:

1. CMake switch from qt4 to qt5.
1. The renderFrame in GLWidget has been removed (not needed in qt5 - don't ask me why).
1. [Dual monitors cause Qt to spam the console with warnings](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33545006/qt5-attempt-to-set-a-screen-on-a-child-window-many-runtime-warning-messages). My solution is to capture the output in `GuiIface.cc` with a custom message handler.
1. MainWindow start size was problematic (xenial + gnome). The startup size would hide the X11 window frame. Reworked the `MainWindow::Init` function to account for this. 
1. Numerous qt api changes.

[Jenkins no-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-no-gpu_ccache/34/console)

I'm working on the Windows side of things.

Please test this a lot.

Also please review [this release-tools](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/260) pull request, which jenkins requires.

content.raw:
Is this necessary? This is running `automoc` on everything, even the gazebo math tests

~~~
$ ls build/gazebo/math
CMakeFiles                     UNIT_Pose_TEST_automoc.cpp
cmake_install.cmake            UNIT_Quaternion_TEST
CTestTestfile.cmake            UNIT_Quaternion_TEST_automoc.cpp
gazebo_math_automoc.cpp        UNIT_Rand_TEST
gzmath.hh                      UNIT_Rand_TEST_automoc.cpp
libgazebo_math.so              UNIT_RotationSpline_TEST
libgazebo_math.so.8            UNIT_RotationSpline_TEST_automoc.cpp
libgazebo_math.so.8.0.0        UNIT_SignalStats_TEST
Makefile                       UNIT_SignalStats_TEST_automoc.cpp
UNIT_Angle_TEST                UNIT_Spline_TEST
UNIT_Angle_TEST_automoc.cpp    UNIT_Spline_TEST_automoc.cpp
UNIT_Box_TEST                  UNIT_Vector2d_TEST
UNIT_Box_TEST_automoc.cpp      UNIT_Vector2d_TEST_automoc.cpp
UNIT_Helpers_TEST              UNIT_Vector2i_TEST
UNIT_Helpers_TEST_automoc.cpp  UNIT_Vector2i_TEST_automoc.cpp
UNIT_Kmeans_TEST               UNIT_Vector3Stats_TEST
UNIT_Kmeans_TEST_automoc.cpp   UNIT_Vector3Stats_TEST_automoc.cpp
UNIT_Matrix3_TEST              UNIT_Vector3_TEST
UNIT_Matrix3_TEST_automoc.cpp  UNIT_Vector3_TEST_automoc.cpp
UNIT_Plane_TEST                UNIT_Vector4_TEST
UNIT_Plane_TEST_automoc.cpp    UNIT_Vector4_TEST_automoc.cpp
UNIT_Pose_TEST
~~~
content.html:
Is this necessary? This is running automoc on everything, even the gazebo math tests

update.description:
This pull request replaces qt4 with qt5. Gazebo8 will only support qt5, and no version of gazebo will support both qt4 and qt5.

Changes include:

1. CMake switch from qt4 to qt5.
1. The renderFrame in GLWidget has been removed (not needed in qt5 - don't ask me why).
1. [Dual monitors cause Qt to spam the console with warnings](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33545006/qt5-attempt-to-set-a-screen-on-a-child-window-many-runtime-warning-messages). My solution is to capture the output in `GuiIface.cc` with a custom message handler.
1. MainWindow start size was problematic (xenial + gnome). The startup size would hide the X11 window frame. Reworked the `MainWindow::Init` function to account for this. 
1. Numerous qt api changes.

[Jenkins no-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-no-gpu_ccache/34/console)

I'm working on the Windows side of things.

Please test this a lot.

Also please review [this release-tools](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/260) pull request, which jenkins requires.
update.title: Qt5

content.raw:
the [most recent successful jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/508/) was built against 3ba40a5cd86, which had the same `find_package` logic:

* #!/osrf/gazebo/src/3ba40a5cd86/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake#SearchForStuff.cmake-544

Our jenkins machines are using yosemite; which version are you using?
content.html:
the most recent successful jenkins build was built against 3ba40a5cd86, which had the same find_package logic:

  • #!/osrf/gazebo/src/3ba40a5cd86/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake#SearchForStuff.cmake-544

Our jenkins machines are using yosemite; which version are you using?

content.raw: Yes. Just to clarify because I believe I expressed myself in confusing way: adding `brew --prefix qt5` to `CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH` everything compiles correctly.
content.html: Yes. Just to clarify because I believe I expressed myself in confusing way: adding brew --prefix qt5 to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH everything compiles correctly.

content.raw: have you made sure that `qt` version 4 is uninstalled?
content.html: have you made sure that qt version 4 is uninstalled?

content.raw: Yes, these line : https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/branches/compare/homebrew_qt5%0Ddefault#Ljenkins-scripts/lib/project-default-devel-homebrew-amd64.bashT71 is equivalent to adding `brew --prefix qt5` to `CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH`.
content.html: Yes, these line : https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/branches/compare/homebrew_qt5%0Ddefault#Ljenkins-scripts/lib/project-default-devel-homebrew-amd64.bashT71 is equivalent to adding brew --prefix qt5 to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH.

content.raw:
Here's what I've been using for the jenkins jobs:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/branches/compare/homebrew_qt5%0Ddefault#diff

Have you made sure to uninstall `qt`?
content.html:
Here's what I've been using for the jenkins jobs:

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/branches/compare/homebrew_qt5%0Ddefault#diff

Have you made sure to uninstall qt?

content.raw:
I tried to compile this branch with homebrew, but given that qt5 is a keg-only formula I had to add `brew --prefix qt5` to the `CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH` environmental variable. 

I was quite confused because it is typically sufficient to define `Qt5_DIR` as `brew --prefix qt5`, but in this case it is not sufficient because we include the different Qt5 parts as different CMake packages in #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2353/qt5/diff#Lcmake/SearchForStuff.cmakeT546 , 
instead of searching them as components of the Qt5 CMake package:
~~~
find_package(Qt5 COMPONENTS Core Widgets OpenGL Test)
~~~
content.html:
I tried to compile this branch with homebrew, but given that qt5 is a keg-only formula I had to add brew --prefix qt5 to the CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH environmental variable.

I was quite confused because it is typically sufficient to define Qt5_DIR as brew --prefix qt5, but in this case it is not sufficient because we include the different Qt5 parts as different CMake packages in #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2353/qt5/diff#Lcmake/SearchForStuff.cmakeT546 , instead of searching them as components of the Qt5 CMake package:

find_package(Qt5 COMPONENTS Core Widgets OpenGL Test)

content.raw: This should compile on Windows now. I do need to up the install instructions.
content.html: This should compile on Windows now. I do need to up the install instructions.
